meanings.definition: The development of agricultural ecosystems intended to be sustainable and self-sufficient.
meanings.sent1: Permaculture involves creating farming systems that can sustain themselves over time.
meanings.sent2: Many farmers are now adopting permaculture techniques to improve their land's sustainability.
meanings.sent3: The permaculture garden was so efficient that it practically took care of itself!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a permaculture of ideas, each one feeding off the other to grow stronger.
meanings.sent5: In the world of permaculture, harmony between nature and agriculture is key.

meanings.definition: The design and maintenance of productive and sustainable human habitats.
meanings.sent1: Permaculture principles focus on creating living spaces that are both productive and eco-friendly.
meanings.sent2: The community embraced permaculture to build houses that blend seamlessly with nature.
meanings.sent3: Their permaculture home was so efficient that it seemed to have a mind of its own!
meanings.sent4: The city skyline was a permaculture of buildings, each one serving a specific purpose.
meanings.sent5: Through permaculture, people learn to live in harmony with their environment.
